content.html:
Perched atop Baltimore's abandoned Westport Generating Station, I made one of my favorite surprise discoveries: A narrow gauge railroad used to deliver coal to the furnaces

See the gallery/history: https://www.abandonedamerica.us/baltimore-gas-and-electric
content.value: Perched atop Baltimore's abandoned Westport Generating Station, I made one of my favorite surprise discoveries: A narrow gauge railroad used to deliver coal to the furnacesSee the gallery/history: https://www.abandonedamerica.us/baltimore-gas-and-electric

photo.alt: A concrete corridor lined with railroad tracks. Black wooden coal cars sit on the tracks, stretching into the distance.

content.html: This is the problem. This is why your excuses don't matter. Because they see you playing the wizard game, and they think you're on their side. They think everyone is on their side cause everyone is playing the wizard game, that they're right, that Joanne is right, and that we're less than human, so they murder us.

content.html: Hey #ScreenshotSaturday, another #ProjectWeirdLittleGuy update! Clover asked "Do we have a day night cycle?" and I answered "We can!"
content.value: Hey #ScreenshotSaturday, another #ProjectWeirdLittleGuy update! Clover asked "Do we have a day night cycle?" and I answered "We can!"

photo.alt: Day and night pass over Weird Little Guy's desert world, long shadows cast by the sun at dawn and dusk, at night the dark is illuminated by fireflies

content.html:
Via Evil Hat Productions on the bird site:

Today the creators of Kids on Brooms are donating 100% of their profits to charities supporting trans people.

If you want to play a wizard school game, play this one. It's great.

Support trans people. Support creators who know #TransRightsAreHumanRights

#ttrpg

content.html: Once AI works out how to do hands then this deepfake crap is going to be one of the biggest problems the world has faced. It has the potential to be extremely damaging and we are sleepwalking into a nightmare with this. I hate everything about it.

photo.alt: A very blocky and untextured model that looks a little bit like a 4WD land rover surrounded by an octohedral lattice, floating in a glass hamster ball, on an alien desert planet with a stone arch behind. Trust me, that description makes it sound way cooler than it looks.
